skill.name: flow-finishing-branch
skill.description: Decide how to complete a development branch: merge, PR, squash, or cleanup.
skill.summary: Decide how to complete a development branch: merge, PR, squash, or cleanup.
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance text with example git commands in code blocks. No executable code, no network calls, no file operations. All 34 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting documentation text as executable code.

content.user_title: Complete git branches with merge, PR, squash, or cleanup
content.value_statement: After development work finishes, choosing how to integrate changes can be unclear. This skill provides a decision matrix and step-by-step guidance to help you select the right approach for your branch completion.
actual_capabilities: Evaluate when to use fast-forward merge, PR, squash, or branch cleanup
Present a decision matrix based on files changed, review needs, and history quality
Provide pre-completion checklist (tests, build, lint, documentation)
Guide execution of chosen merge strategy with specific git commands
Integrate with flow-release for automated branch handling
limitations: Does not execute git commands automatically
Does not connect to remote repositories
Requires manual verification of pre-completion checklist items

use_cases.title: Fast-forward small changes
use_cases.description: Quickly merge personal branches with clean history when no review is needed.

use_cases.title: Create pull requests
use_cases.description: Generate proper review workflows with CI verification and audit trails.

use_cases.title: Clean up abandoned branches
use_cases.description: Identify and remove abandoned or failed experiment branches to keep repository tidy.

prompt_templates.title: Simple merge
prompt_templates.scenario: Quickly merge a small feature branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use flow-finishing-branch to merge my feature branch into main. I made changes to 3 files and no one else reviewed it.

prompt_templates.title: Team merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me complete this feature branch using flow-finishing-branch. The team needs to review and CI must verify before merge.

prompt_templates.title: Messy history
prompt_templates.scenario: Clean up a cluttered commit history
prompt_templates.prompt: I have 20 small WIP commits in my branch. Use flow-finishing-branch to decide the best merge strategy.

prompt_templates.title: Branch cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: This experiment branch failed. Use flow-finishing-branch to show me how to safely delete it.

output_examples.input: Use flow-finishing-branch to help me merge my feature/auth branch into main
output: Based on your scenario, here's the analysis:
You have 8 files changed (not a small change)
Team context not specified (default to PR recommendation)

output_examples.input: I have 5 small commits that should be squashed. How do I clean up this branch?
This feature branch was abandoned. How do I safely delete it?
output: Warning: Work will be lost. Ensure nothing is needed.

best_practices: Default to PR for team projects even when not required
Run the pre-completion checklist before choosing any merge option
Use the decision matrix to objectively evaluate your situation
Clean up local branches after successful merge or abandon
anti_patterns: Skipping PR because it takes too long - audit trails matter
Merging without verifying tests, build, and lint pass
Ignoring commit history quality - it helps with debugging
Deleting branches before confirming successful merge

faq.question: Does this skill execute git commands?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides guidance and documentation. You must manually run the suggested commands.

faq.question: When should I use fast-forward merge?
faq.answer: Use fast-forward for small changes under 5 files when you have a clean commit history and no review requirement.

faq.question: What happens to my commit history with squash merge?
faq.answer: All commits are combined into a single logical commit, losing detailed history but creating a cleaner main branch.

faq.question: Is my data safe when deleting branches?
faq.answer: Yes, but only after merge or if the work is truly abandoned. Deleted branch work cannot be recovered locally.

faq.question: Can I use this with any git hosting service?
faq.answer: Yes, the concepts apply to GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket. GitHub CLI commands (gh) are documented for GitHub.

faq.question: How does this differ from manual git workflows?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured decision framework so you do not have to remember when to use each merge strategy.
